BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: THE SAN FRANCISCO SOCIETY FOR THE

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO SAVE/PROTECT ANIMALS, PROVIDE CARE, ADVOCATE FOR THEIR WELFARE, ENHANCE THE HUMAN-ANIMAL BOND.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE SF SPCA IS TO SAVE AND PROTECT ANIMALS, TO PROVIDE CARE AND TREATMENT, TO ADVOCATE FOR THEIR WELFARE AND TO ENHANCE THE HUMAN-ANIMAL BOND.
IRS990.Desc: VETERINARY SERVICES - WITH MORE THAN 40 VETERINARIANS ON STAFF AND ACCREDITATION FROM THE AMERICAN ANIMAL HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION, THE SF SPCA RANKS AMONG TOP VETERINARY HOSPITALS IN NORTH AMERICA. THAT EXPERTISE ALSO INFORMS THE SPAY AND NEUTER CLINIC, COMMUNITY MEDICINE, AND SHELTER MEDICINE TEAMS.VETERINARY HOSPITALS - THE SF SPCA OPERATES TWO FULL-SERVICE DOG AND CAT VETERINARY HOSPITALS, ONE LOCATED IN THE MISSION DISTRICT AND THE OTHER IN PACIFIC HEIGHTS. VETERINARIANS COMPLETE MORE THAN 55,000 EXAMINATIONS PER YEAR AND HOSPITALS OFFER COMPREHENSIVE MEDICAL AND SURGICAL CARE, DENTAL SERVICES, RADIOLOGY AND ULTRASOUND, A FULL RANGE OF DIAGNOSTIC AND MONITORING EQUIPMENT, PHARMACY, 24-HOUR EMERGENCY SERVICES, AND 24-HOUR NURSING CARE FOR HOSPITALIZED PATIENTS. THANKS TO GENEROUS DONORS, WE ARE ABLE TO OFFER DISCOUNTED MEDICAL SERVICES TO QUALIFIED PEOPLE SO THAT PETS CAN STAY WITH LOVING GUARDIANS RATHER THAN LANDING IN SHELTERS BECAUSE OF ILLNESS.SPAY/NEUTER CLINIC - THE SF SPCA'S FULL-SERVICE SPAY/NEUTER CLINIC WAS THE FIRST FACILITY IN SAN FRANCISCO TO PROVIDE LOW-COST SPAY/NEUTER SURGERY. STAFF PERFORMED 8,368 SURGERIES IN THE 2017-2018 FISCAL YEAR, 82% OF WHICH WERE DISCOUNTED OR FREE. THE CLINIC ALSO PERFORMED 688 SPAY/NEUTER SURGERIES AT NO CHARGE FOR FREE-ROAMING CATS THROUGH ITS TRAP-NEUTER-RETURN PROGRAM. SHELTER MEDICINE - THE SF SPCA'S SHELTER MEDICINE PROGRAM PROVIDES BEST-IN-CLASS VETERINARY SERVICES FOR HOMELESS CATS AND DOGS IN OUR SHELTERS. THE SHELTER VETERINARY AND BEHAVIOR TEAMS EMPHASIZE DISEASE PREVENTION AND EFFECTIVE 'HERD' HEALTH PRINCIPLES TO LIMIT THE LENGTH OF STAY FOR EACH ANIMAL AND AVOID CROSS CONTAMINATION WHILE ANIMALS ARE IN THE SHELTER. BREAKTHROUGH RESEARCH, OBSERVATION AND REMEDIATION TO MANAGE BEHAVIORS AND CONTAGIOUS DISEASE ALLOW ANIMALS TO MOVE QUICKLY TO FOREVER HOMES. COMMUNITY MEDICINE - THE SF SPCA PROVIDES FREE/ LOW-COST VETERINARY CARE SERVICES SUCH AS SPAY/NEUTER SURGERY VOUCHERS, BI-MONTHLY VETERINARY CLINICS IN UNDERSERVED NEIGHBORHOODS, AND VETERINARY SERVICES AT NAVIGATION CENTERS FOR PEOPLE TRANSITIONING OUT OF HOMELESSNESS. IN THE 2017-18 FISCAL YEAR, COMMUNITY CLINICS PROVIDED 3,123 FREE VACCINES AT MOBILE CLINICS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: ADOPTION SERVICES - HELPING CATS AND DOGS BECOME ADOPTABLE AND MATCHING THEM WITH CARING GUARDIANS IS CENTRAL TO THE WORK OF THE SF SPCA. THE ADOPTION CENTER, WITH LIGHT, AIRY DOG APARTMENTS AND CAT CONDOS, HAS BECOME A MODEL FOR 21ST CENTURY CAGELESS ANIMAL SHELTERS. IN 2017-18, 5,245 ANIMALS FOUND PERMANENT HOMES THROUGH OUR ADOPTION CENTER. PET LOSS SUPPORT - THE PET LOSS SUPPORT GROUP IS A FREE, MONTHLY PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES A SUPPORTIVE, NON-JUDGMENTAL ENVIRONMENT FOR GRIEVING PET OWNERS OR THOSE FACING THE IMMINENT DEATH OF A TERMINALLY ILL OR AGED ANIMAL. THE SF SPCA WAS THE FIRST HUMANE SOCIETY TO OFFER REGULAR MONTHLY COUNSELING SERVICES WHEN WE LAUNCHED THIS PROGRAM IN 1983. SIDO PROGRAM - MANY PEOPLE DON'T HAVE A FRIEND OR RELATIVE TO APPOINT AS GUARDIAN FOR THEIR PET SHOULD THEY PASS AWAY. ENROLLMENT IN THE SIDO PROGRAM GUARANTEES THAT DOGS AND CATS WILL MOVE DIRECTLY TO THE SF SPCA'S ADOPTION PROGRAM FOR PERSONALIZED LOVING CARE AND ATTENTION ACCORDING TO THE WISHES OF THEIR GUARDIANS. THE PROGRAM IS NAMED FOR SIDO, A SAN FRANCISCO DOG WHOSE OWNER DIED IN 1979. SIDO WAS TO BE EUTHANIZED ACCORDING TO THE OWNER'S WILL. HER CASE, SUCCESSFULLY LITIGATED BY THE SF SPCA SET PRECEDENTS IN ANIMAL RIGHTS. THE RESULTING PROGRAM AND LEGISLATION HAVE BEEN COPIED BY CITIES AND SHELTERS ACROSS THE U.S..FOSTER PROGRAMS - LAST FISCAL YEAR, FOSTER AND FOSPICE VOLUNTEERS PROVIDED A WARM, SAFE ENVIRONMENT OUTSIDE THE SHELTER WALLS FOR 1,518 ANIMALS, NEARLY ONE THIRD OF ALL ADOPTED ANIMALS. THESE VOLUNTEERS HELPED THE MOST VULNERABLE, UNDERAGE, SICK AND INJURED DOGS, CATS, KITTENS, AND PUPPIES WITH ROUND-THE-CLOCK TENDER LOVING CARE. FOSPICE - THE SF SPCA OFFERS END-OF-LIFE FOSTER HOSPICE CARE FOR SHELTER ANIMALS DIAGNOSED WITH LIFE-LIMITING, NON-CONTAGIOUS ILLNESS SUCH AS RENAL FAILURE OR NON-PAINFUL TYPES OF CANCER. WHILE THESE ANIMALS ARE NOT SUFFERING, THEIR MEDICAL CONDITION AND POOR PROGNOSIS PREVENTS THE SF SPCA FROM SEEKING REGULAR ADOPTIVE HOMES FOR THEM. THE SF SPCA MAINTAINS LEGAL GUARDIANSHIP OF THESE SPECIAL-NEEDS ANIMALS AND COVERS THEIR MEDICAL COSTS. THE VOLUNTEERS WHO ARE WILLING AND ABLE TO PROVIDE HOSPICE CARE PERFORM THE NOBLE TASK OF ENABLING HOMELESS ANIMALS TO LIVE AND DIE WITH DIGNITY, IN A LOVING ENVIRONMENT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: EDUCATION PROGRAMS - THE SF SPCA PROVIDES A RANGE OF EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS THAT ENHANCE THE HUMAN-ANIMAL BOND AND INCREASE PET RETENTION.DOG AND CAT TRAINING - TO MAINTAIN ITS LEAD AS THE MOST HUMANE MAJOR US CITY FOR COMPANION ANIMALS, THE SF SPCA OFFERS AN EXTENSIVE SERIES OF PUBLIC CLASSES AND PRIVATE CONSULTS IN ANIMAL BEHAVIOR, AS WELL AS A HELP LINE, EMAIL SUPPORT, AND ONLINE RESOURCES. WE HAVE FOUND THAT BEHAVIOR IS A TOP REASON FOR DISSATISFACTION WITH A CAT OR DOG; OUR EFFORTS IN BEHAVIOR AND TRAINING HELP PREVENT ANIMAL SURRENDER. WITH CLASSES RANGING FROM PUPPY AND BASIC OBEDIENCE CLASSES, TO CAT CLAW CLIPPING COURSES, TO ADVANCED TRAINING AND AGILITY, WE HAVE SOMETHING FOR EVERY ANIMAL. LAST FISCAL YEAR 6,003 DOGS, CATS, AND THEIR PEOPLE BENEFITED FROM THESE COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAMS. HUMANE EDUCATION - HUMANE EDUCATION IS A VITAL PART OF THE SF SPCA'S COMMITMENT TO IMPROVING THE LIVES OF COMPANION ANIMALS. THE PROGRAM TEACHES CHILDREN EMPATHY, COMPASSION, AND RESPECT FOR LIFE, AND FOSTERS HUMANE VALUES AND POSITIVE INTERACTIONS BETWEEN ANIMALS, CHILDREN, AND ADULTS. THE PROGRAM BRINGS ANIMALS TO SAN FRANCISCO SCHOOLS, OFFERS EDUCATIONAL RESOURCE MATERIALS FOR TEACHERS AND FIELD TRIPS TO THE SF SPCA, AND PROVIDES WEEKEND, AFTER-SCHOOL, AND HOLIDAY OR SUMMER PROGRAMS FOR YOUTH. DURING FISCAL YEAR 2017-18, 8,368 YOUTH PARTICIPATED IN HANDS-ON ACTIVITIES AND INQUIRY-BASED CLASSES THAT INCREASED THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF ANIMAL BEHAVIOR. BY PROVIDING A SAFE PLACE FOR CHILDREN TO BOND WITH A VARIETY OF ANIMALS AND LEARN PROPER HANDLING TECHNIQUES, HUMANE EDUCATION PROMOTES ADVOCACY ON BEHALF OF ANIMALS SO THAT YOUTH WILL USE THEIR COMPASSION TO PROTECT AND HELP ANIMALS IN OUR COMMUNITY THROUGHOUT THEIR LIVES. WE ARE ENCOURAGING THE NEXT GENERATION OF ANIMAL ADVOCATES. ANIMAL ASSISTED THERAPY - THE ANIMAL ASSISTED THERAPY PROGRAM (AAT) BRINGS THE HEALING PRESENCE OF ANIMALS TO PEOPLE IN A RANGE OF LOCATIONS, INCLUDING HOSPITAL WARDS, NURSING HOMES, PSYCHIATRIC CLINICS, SENIOR CENTERS, AND SCHOOLS. SF SPCA VOLUNTEERS, MANY WORKING WITH THEIR OWN ANIMAL, CONDUCT VISITS ON A REGULAR BASIS. EACH VISITING ANIMAL: DOGS, CATS, BIRDS, GUINEA PIGS AND OTHER ANIMALS IS CERTIFIED THROUGH MEDICAL AND SOCIALIZATION TESTING BEFORE GOING ON VISITS. WHEN THE PROGRAM WAS FOUNDED IN 1981, THE SF SPCA WAS THE FIRST ANIMAL WELFARE ORGANIZATION IN THE NATION TO OFFER ANIMAL ASSISTED THERAPY. TODAY IT IS A LEADER IN THE GROWING FIELD. LAST YEAR, 100+ SF SPCA VOLUNTEER TEAMS - A HUMAN AND A THERAPY ANIMAL - VISITED 105,906 PEOPLE IN OUR CITY.IN ADDITION TO THE GENERAL PROGRAM, AAT OFFERS SPECIALIZED PROGRAMS LIKE PUPPY DOG TALES READING PROGRAM, WHICH PLACES DOGS INTO SAN FRANCISCO CLASSROOMS AND LIBRARIES TO GIVE CHILDREN WHO NEED REMEDIAL ASSISTANCE, OR WHOSE FIRST LANGUAGE IS NOT ENGLISH, NON-JUDGMENTAL ENCOURAGEMENT AND ATTENTION AS THEY READ ALOUD. THE MASTERY, EMPATHY AND SOCIAL CONSCIENCE THROUGH ANIMAL ASSISTED THERAPY (MESCAAT) PROGRAM WORKS WITH YOUTH IN NEED OF MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SUPPORT, WHILE CANINE CONNECTIONS PROVIDES BOTH ANIMAL ASSISTED THERAPY AND TRAINING IN ANIMAL HANDLING TO VETERANS EXPERIENCING PTSD.VOLUNTEER PROGRAM - THE SF SPCA COULD NOT OPERATE WITHOUT THE GENEROSITY OF MORE THAN 1,420 VOLUNTEERS WHO WORKED AS CAT SOCIALIZERS, ADOPTION MATCHMAKERS, DOG WALKERS, AND MANY OTHER ROLES.MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS - THIS DEPARTMENT PROVIDES UP-TO-DATE INFORMATION, EDUCATION, EVENTS, AND NOTICE OF OPPORTUNITIES TO ADVOCATE FOR ANIMALS AND CELEBRATE THE HUMAN/ANIMAL BOND.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TOTAL EXPENSES ON LOBBYING ACTIVITIES WAS $24,530. THE ORGANIZATION ENGAGED FEARLESS ADVOCACY, INC. TO APPEAL TO STATE LAWMAKERS REGARDING LEGISLATION IMPACTING ANIMALS IN CALIFORNIA, INCLUDING ASSEMBLY BILLS 1151, 1780, 2274, 2300, 2445, 2774, 2791, 3040, AND SENATE BILLS 1005, 1017, AND 1305.

THE ORGANIZATION HOLDS THE FOLLOWING TWO ENDOWMENTS: 1. HEARING DOG ENDOWMENT - TO PROVIDE FUNDS FOR THE SF SPCA'S HEARING DOG PROGRAM. 2. LUDWIG ENDOWMENT - TO PROVIDE FUNDS FOR CONTINUING EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES FOR STAFF.

THE SF SPCA IS A QUALIFIED ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME AND CALIFORNIA FRANCHISE TAXES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF SECTIONS 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND 23701(D) OF THE CALIFORNIA REVENUE AND TAXATION CODE, RESPECTIVELY. THE SF SPCA RECOGNIZES THE EFFECT OF INCOME TAX POSITIONS ONLY IF THOSE POSITIONS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT OF BEING SUSTAINED, AND CHANGES IN RECOGNITION OR MEASUREMENT ARE REFLECTED IN THE PERIOD IN WHICH THE CHANGE IN JUDGMENT OCCURS. THE SF SPCA HAS EVALUATED ITS CURRENT TAX POSITIONS AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT AS OF JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, IT DOES NOT HAVE ANY SIGNIFICANT UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS FOR WHICH A RESERVE WOULD BE NECESSARY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2B, COLUMN (V)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TOTAL PAYMENT TO FUNDRAISER IS $358,716.93, INCLUDING MAIL SOLICITATIONS OF $302,289.39 PAID TO RKD ALPHA DOG AND SPECIAL FUNDRAISING EVENTS OF $56,427.54 PAID TO WINSLOW AND ASSOCIATES.

THE SF SPCA PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO GUARDIANS WHO ARE UNABLE TO AFFORD VETERINARY CARE. TO QUALIFY FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, GUARDIANS MUST PROVIDE PROOF OF SAN FRANCISCO RESIDENCY, DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED AND PROVIDE PROOF OF INCOME, HAVE ALL HOUSEHOLD ANIMALS SPAYED-NEUTERED, AND BE CURRENT WITH ALL PAYMENTS TOWARDS PREVIOUSLY AWARDED FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. EMERGENCY CARE GRANTS ARE AWARDED ONLY TO GUARDIANS WHO HAVE APPLIED FOR AND EXHAUSTED CARECREDIT, A CREDIT CARD SPECIFICALLY FOR VETERINARY SERVICES.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: SENIOR VP OF PEOPLE DEVELOPMENT AND

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE NUMBER REPORTED IN COLUMN (B) REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTORS, NOT THE NUMBER OF ITEMS RECEIVED.
THRIFT STORE DONATIONS ARE SENT TO COMMUNITY THRIFT AND SOLD ON THE ORGANIZATION'S BEHALF. CAR DONATIONS ARE SENT TO AGENCY AND SOLD ON THE ORGANIZATION'S BEHALF.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BEFORE FINALIZATION, THE PRESIDENT AND CFO WILL REVIEW THE RETURN. ONCE REVIEWED, THE RETURN WILL BE CIRCULATED TO THE ENTIRE BOARD FOR SIGN-OFF.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS PROVIDED TO AND APPLIES TO ALL DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, AND EMPLOYEES. PRIOR TO BOARD OR COMMITTEE ACTION ON A CONTRACT OR TRANSACTION INVOLVING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, A DIRECTOR OR COMMITTEE MEMBER HAVING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND WHO IS IN ATTENDANCE AT THE MEETING SHALL DISCLOSE ALL FACTS MATERIAL TO THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST. A PERSON WHO HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST SHALL NOT PARTICPATE IN OR BE PERMITTED TO HEAR THE BOARD'S OR COMMITTEE'S DISCUSSION OF THE MATTER, EXCEPT TO DISCLOSE MATERIAL FACTS AND TO RESPOND TO QUESTIONS. SUCH PERSON SHALL NOT ATTEMPT TO EXERT HIS OR HER PERSONAL INFLUENCE WITH RESPECT TO THE MATTER, EITHER AT OR OUTSIDE THE MEETING. IN THE EVENT IT IS NOT ENTIRELY CLEAR THAT A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS, THE INDIVIDUAL WITH THE POTENTIAL CONFLICT SHALL DISCLOSE THE CIRCUMSTANCES TO THE CHAIR OR THE CHAIR'S DESIGNEE, WHO SHALL DETERMINE WHETHER A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OFFICERS OF THE BOARD MEET ANNUALLY TO REVIEW THE PERFORMANCE OF THE PRESIDENT & CFO TO SET OBJECTIVES FOR THE NEXT FISCAL YEAR. THE BOARD ALSO REVIEWS COMPENSATION FOR THE COMING YEAR AND A COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD CONDUCTS PERFORMANCE REVIEWS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, ANNUAL FINANCIAL AUDIT AND FORM 990 UPON WRITTEN REQUEST TO THE COMMUNICATIONS OFFICE OF THE SF SPCA AT 201 ALABAMA STREET, SAN FRANCISCO, CA 94103 OR BY EMAIL TO PUBLICINFO@SFSPCA.ORG.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEAR.
